content.body: I wonder what the story behind this RFC standardizing C header and implementation files is. https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6234#section-8

> <@domenicdenicola:matrix.org> I wonder what the story behind this RFC standardizing C header and implementation files is. https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6234#section-8

"Much of the text herein was adapted by the authors from FIPS 180-2."
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @domenicdenicola:matrix.org
I wonder what the story behind this RFC standardizing C header and implementation files is. https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6234#section-8
"Much of the text herein was adapted by the authors from FIPS 180-2."

content.body: I don't know for sure that FIPS 180-2 defines SHA-2 using C code, but I wouldn't put it past them.

> <@domenicdenicola:matrix.org> I wonder what the story behind this RFC standardizing C header and implementation files is. https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6234#section-8

This isn't even the only RFC containing source code. See https://martinthomson.github.io/rfc-code/
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @domenicdenicola:matrix.org

This isn't even the only RFC containing source code. See https://martinthomson.github.io/rfc-code/

content.body: How does fetch for import() work in workers? https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-import-call-runtime-semantics-evaluation calls HostLoadImportedModule ,but https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#hostloadimportedmodule throws in 2.3.
